overviews.title: MBA in Data Analytics: Course Fees, Admission 2026, Syllabus, Top Colleges, Career Scope
overview: MBA in Data Analytics is a PG degree that will combine business administration principles with advanced data analysis techniques to provide you with the skills that you'll use to analyze and use data for decision-making in numerous business contexts.
The below table indicates the MBA in Data Analytics Course details :
Master of Business Administration in Data Analytics
Full-time MBA in Data Analytics: 2 years Online/ Distance MBA in Data Analytics: 1- 2 years Executive MBA in Data Analytics: 1 - 1.5 years Integrated MBA in Data Analytics: 5 years
Entrance Exam + Group Discussion + Personal Interview
Amity University, Symbiosis Centre for Information Technology (SCIT), SAGE University Bhopal, etc.
Data Analyst, Business Analyst, Marketing Analyst, Operations Analyst, Chief Data Officer (CDO), etc.
Note - This information is taken from different sources and may vary.

criteria_points: Physics, Chemistry, Maths, Economics or statistics background is preferred.
At least have 50% marks in graduation
admission_process: Here is the general steps for Admission to MBA in Data Analytics Course :

faqs.question: What is MBA in Data Analytics course?
faqs.answer: The duration of MBA in Data Analytics is Typically 18 to 24 months , with options for full-time, part-time, or online study. A regular MBA in Data Analytics degree is a two-year course divided into four semesters. However, certain private institutes offer one-year PGDM programs as well. Only individuals with a bachelor's degree in any discipline or a BBA program from a recognised institute or university are eligible for an MBA in Data Analytics.

faqs.question: What does an MBA in Data Analytics do?
faqs.answer: Graduates typically analyze data to derive insights, inform strategic decisions and drive business improvements. They may work in roles such as data analysts, business analysts or managers overseeing analytics projects.

faqs.question: Why should I choose to pursue MBA in Data Analytics course?
faqs.answer: High Demand: Businesses increasingly rely on data to drive decisions creating a strong demand for professionals skilled in data analysis. Career Advancement: An MBA can open doors to leadership positions helping you transition into roles like data strategist, analytics manager or chief data officer. Innovation and Problem Solving: You'll learn to leverage data to tackle complex business challenges and drive innovation. Lucrative Salaries: Data analytics roles often come with competitive compensation reflecting the skill's value in today's job market.

faqs.question: What is the duration of MBA in Data Analytics course?
faqs.answer: MBA in Data Analytics Course typically spans 1-2 years, depending on whether it is pursued full-time Course, Part-Time MBA in Data Analytics , or MBA in Data Analytics Online Courses . Accelerated programs may take 12-18 months.

faqs.question: Is a Masters in Data Analytics easy?
faqs.answer: Like any graduate program, a Master's in Data Analytics can be challenging requiring dedication and effort. The difficulty often depends on your background in quantitative subjects and your willingness to engage with the material. However, many find it rewarding and manageable with the right preparation. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: What basic knowledge is required for MBA in data analytics? I am a B.Com graduate and I want to pursue my career in data analytics.
faqs.answer: You should be good with statistics and analytics part. Apart from that no such requirements are required before joining. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: What are the core subjects provided in MBA in Data Analytics course?
faqs.answer: MBA in Data Analytics is a 2 years post graduate Course that spans four semesters. During each semester, students study a variety of subjects related to management and business analytics. In the third semester, students are required to complete an internship. The Syllabus of MBA in Data Analytics includes: Strategic Management Operation Management Business Mathematics and Statistics Managerial Economics Managerial Communication Data Science R and Python Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: What skills do I need to excel in MBA in Data Analytics program?
faqs.answer: Following are the list of some skills that you need to excel in MBA in Data Analytics program : Analytical thinking and problem-solving skills Knowledge of programming languages like Python, R, or SQL Familiarity with data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI Strong business acumen and communication skills Not satisfied with answer? faqs.question: What are the career opportunities after completing this MBA?
faqs.answer: There are various career opportunities for the graduates of MBA in Data Analytics . Below is the list of some job opportunities: Data Analyst Data Scientist Chief Data Officer (CDO) Analytics Manager Business Analyst Marketing Analyst Operations Analyst

faqs.question: Which industries and sectors can MBA Data Analytics graduates work in?
faqs.answer: Graduates can find opportunities in a wide range of industries including: Finance Healthcare E-commerce Consulting Technology Retail

faqs.question: Which Industries hire MBA in Data Analytics graduates?
faqs.answer: Below are the list of Industries that hire a MBA in Data Analytics Graduate : IT and Software Development E-commerce Banking and Financial Services Healthcare Manufacturing Retail

faqs.question: Is Data Analytics a good career in India?
faqs.answer: Yes, Data Analytics can be a good career in India. Data Analytics is in high demand right now accross many sectors like manufacturing, banking, finance, e-commerce, etc. Data Analytics offer extensive opportunities in various fields with salary ranging from INR 2 Lacs - INR 20 lakh. And as India, is significantly approaching data driven methods in various sectors, data analytics can prove to boost economic development and innovation. Hope this answer proves beneficial to you!

faq_section.title: MBA in Data Analytics Course FAQs
introduction: Here are some important Questions related to MBA in Data Analytics .

faqs.question: How does an MBA in Data Analytics differ from a general MBA?
faqs.answer: An MBA in Data Analytics focuses specifically on data analysis, statistical methods and data-driven decision-making while a general MBA covers broader business concepts without a specific emphasis on data. The specialised programme prepares graduates for the roles that requires strong analytical skills in addition to business acumen.

faqs.question: What are the differences between data Science, data analytics and business analytics?
faqs.answer: Data Science - The word describes a wide variety of information-gathering frameworks and techniques. Translated into more layman's terms. Data Science aims to discover patterns in raw data by using a wide variety of tools, machine-learning techniques, and algorithms. Data Analytics - Productivity enhancement is the procedure for maximizing the financial advantage of a company. In this process, we analyze data Sets and infer meaning from the data they include. Different methods exist for extracting and organizing data to identify and analyse behavioural data, which is done based on the needs of the company. It was also referred to as " data analysis" on our end. Business Analytics - It's the practice of using statistical methods to investigate collected data in order to extract useful information for commercial enterprises. Business, management, and IT are the three primary components. Business analytics are rising in popularity at a lightning-fast rate. This area of study seems to have a promising future.

faqs.question: Does Data Analytics require coding?
faqs.answer: While coding is helpful especially in advanced data analytics roles, it is not always necessary. Many tools (like Excel, Tableau, and others) allow you to perform data analysis without extensive coding knowledge.

faqs.question: What are data analytics and business intelligence?
faqs.answer: Business intelligence addresses ongoing operations, helping businesses and departments meet organizational goals. Data analytics can help companies that want to transform the way they do business. Both disciplines can benefit from a little data preparation. And Data analytics is raw data is collected, cleansed, categorized, converted, aggregated, validated, and otherwise transformed. Clean data is also helpful for BI.

faqs.question: Which MBA specialization is better in terms of scope and future growth between data analytics and finance?
faqs.answer: Finance is one of the top five specializations while pursuing MBA. Data Analytics is also a good field but as of now, not a lot top colleges offer this course. If you're really serious in making a career in the finance world, opt for Finance. Else you can choose Data Analytics.

faqs.question: Looking for part time MBA courses in business analytics or Data analytics?
faqs.answer: For MBA in Data Analytics , you can go for the following colleges: List: Massachusetts Institute of Technology (Sloan); Carnegie Mellon University (Tepper); Georgia Institute of Technology (Scheller); University of Pennsylvania (Wharton); New York University (Stern); The University of California, Berkeley (Haas). .

faqs.question: Is it worth to pursue a course in data analytics for a student who aim of pursuing MBA in finance?
faqs.answer: This is an age of data analytics to discover business knowledge in org databases and data warehouses to have competitive advantage. DA is extensively used by finance specialists. Thus, it is a good idea to learn DA.

faqs.question: How much does it matter that we have completed data analytics as a course or completed through the MBA in data analytics?
faqs.answer: A career as a Data Analyst seems quite promising owing to the high concentration of analytics in India. After an MBA in Data Analytics course , a professional can expect high growth, better job opportunities, and improved on-job skills.

faqs.question: What is the difference between an MBA in Data Analytics and an MS in Data Analytics?
faqs.answer: MBA in Data Analytics focuses on combining analytics with management and business strategy. Whereas, MS in Data Analytics is more technical, emphasizing programming, algorithms, and advanced analytics techniques.

faqs.question: Is it expensive to pursue Data Analytics in India?
faqs.answer: Hi, it can be observed that on average equal number of colleges offer different fee category for students as you can refer below. Hope this helps you! Table: Total Fee | No. of Colleges | Popular Colleges || Free | 10+ | Coursera, Great Learning, Accenture, etc. || < INR 1 lakh | 90+ | JECRC University, Coursera, Great Learning, etc. || INR 1-2 lakh | 40+ | Galgotias University, IUL, NIT Trichy, etc. || INR 2-3 lakh | 40+ | Women's Christian College, Galgotias University, Rathinam College of Arts and Science, etc. || INR 3-5 lakh | 40+ | MIT-WPU, Presidency College, T. John Group of Institutions, etc. || > INR 5 lakh | 50+ | Amity University, Jain Deemed-to-be University, Galgotias University, etc.

faqs.question: Can I know about MBA in data analytics? What is the duration and fee structure of this course?
faqs.answer: MBA in data analytics is a rare course in India. Basically, it deals with data mining and organisation. Large companies will have truckloads of data that has to be managed accordingly in order to carry forward the business operations. This is the job that people with a degree in data analytics do. It basically deals with programming languages such as R, Python etc. The fee structure will vary between 5 and 10 Lacs. All the best.

faqs.question: Is data analytics a good career?
faqs.answer: Yes, data analytics is one of the most promising careers. As per IBEF reports, the market for data analytics is expected to create over 11 million jobs by 2026. A data analyst's salary in India ranges from Rs. 1.8 Lacs to Rs. 11.4 Lacs per year. In top Indian companies, the average salary for a data analyst is around Rs. 4.2 LPA. As per estimates, around 97,000 jobs are currently available in data analytics. You can pursue an M.Tech or certification course in data analysis, like SQL for Data Analysis, to start a career in this field.

faqs.question: Can I know about business data analytics.
faqs.answer: Data analytics involves analyzing datasets to uncover trends and insights that are subsequently used to make informed organizational decisions. Business analytics is focused on analyzing various types of information to make practical, data-driven business decisions, and implementing changes based on those decisions.

faqs.question: When will ATMA result release?
faqs.answer: ATMA result is usually released within a week from the exam. ATMA result 2026 for the February session exam will be released on February 28, 2026, at 5 PM. Candidates who appeared for the ATMA exam, can login on the official website and download the scorecards.

faqs.question: What is the salary that a data analytics fresher can get in New Delhi?
faqs.answer: A good qualified data analytics graduate with good IT educational background can get a starting salary of Rs. 5+ Lakhs but an MBA graduate with data analytics can get a CTC of above 8 Lakhs in MNCs.

faqs.question: How can an MBA in Data Analytics course help in career advancement?
faqs.answer: An MBA in Data Analytics equips you with both technical and managerial skills enhancing your ability to interpret data and make strategic decisions. This combination prepares you for leadership roles increases your employability and positions you for promotions in data-driven organizations.

faqs.question: What is the difference between an MBA in Data Analytics and an MSc in Data Science?
faqs.answer: If you're interested in business decision-making and leadership roles then an MBA in Data Analytics is better. If you prefer coding, statistics, and machine learning, an MSc in Data Science is a better option for you.

faqs.question: What tools and software are used in an MBA in Data Analytics?
faqs.answer: There are various tools that and software that you will learn during the course which are mentioned below: Knowing these tools increases your job prospects and makes you a valuable candidate in the job market. List: Data Analytics Tools: Python, R, SAS; Database Management: SQL, NoSQL; Big Data & Cloud Computing: Hadoop, Apache Spark, AWS; Machine Learning & AI: TensorFlow, Scikit-Learn; Data Visualization: Tableau, Power BI; Business Intelligence (BI) Tools: Google Analytics, Excel

faqs.question: What is the difficulty level of MAH MBA CET?
faqs.answer: MAH MBA CET is a moderately difficult exam. It’s difficulty level is lower than CAT but higher than MAT or ATMA. A major factor that makes MAH CET a difficult test to crack is that the questions are presented in random order and sectional weightage vary in every slot. So, candidates cannot anticipate or plan how many and which type of questions to get to their target score. Also, the MAH MBA CET is dominated by Logical Reasoning questions and there are comparatively less Quantitative Aptitude questions. Since, there is no set pattern, candidates cannot pre-plan. They need to make a strategy and implement it as soon as they see the question paper. So, those who can think on their feet and can crack the exam better than others.

faqs.question: Which field is best to become a Data Analyst?
faqs.answer: All this depends over the personal choice and interest. The fields you are good at or you had interest, you should go for that. Some of the best fields are Finance, Healthcare, Retail, Business Intelligence, Technology & Entertainment. These are some of the best fields where data analyst is very much required.

faqs.question: What is the future of MBA in Data Analytics?
faqs.answer: The future of MBA in Data Analytics graduate is very bright with more industries integrating AI & Big Data. As per the research, By 2030,  80% of global companies will rely on data-driven decision-making which will help in increasing job demand for analytics professionals in India as well as abroad.

faqs.question: What are the benefits of an MBA in Data Analytics compared to a regular MBA?
faqs.answer: If you are interested in technology and data-driven business decisions then MBA in Data Analytics is a better choice for you and if you want to explore more career options in management than general MBA is best suited for you.

faqs.question: Can I start my own business after an MBA in Data Analytics?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can become a Data Analytics Consultant or start your own AI & Analytics startup . Many businesses in todays scenerio need data-driven solutions and with expertise in data analytics, you can also provide consulting services to the companies looking to implement analytics in their operations.

faqs.question: How can I prepare for MAH MBA CET?
faqs.answer: MAH MBA CET preparation can be done in two ways – 1. Join a coaching institute 2. Prepare by self study. If you choose the former, you will get complete guidance from the teachers and mentors, but if you choose the later, you will have to be your own guide. Self study will require a lot more discipline and dedication. Take simple yet impactful steps. First of all, check the exam syllabus and see how much time you will require to cover the topics. If you are already familiar with the topics included in the MAH MBA CET syllabus, you will be able to have an estimation of the time required. Ideally, you should start MAH MBA CET preparation about nine months in advance. That will give you an ample time to understand and master the topics included in the syllabus through theory and practice questions. Join online study groups for problem solving and doubt clearing. Staying in contact with peers will keep you motivated for preparation.

faqs.question: How can freshers enter the field of Data Analytics after an MBA in Data Analytics?
faqs.answer: Freshers who have graduated from MBA in Data Analytics can start their careers by: List: Taking internships in data analytics.; Completing Google/Microsoft/AWS data certifications for good placements.; Working as a Data Analyst before transitioning to Data Scientist roles.; Learning Tableau, Power BI and Python to build a strong resume.

faqs.question: What is the demand for Data Analysts in government jobs?
faqs.answer: The demand for Data Analysts in government jobs is very high as government organizations are also hiring data analytics professionals for: List: NITI Aayog – Data-driven policy-making.; Indian Railways – Predictive maintenance analytics.; Election Commission of India – Data analysis for voting patterns.; RBI & SEBI – Fraud detection and financial risk analysis.

faqs.question: For how long is MAH CET score valid for admission?
faqs.answer: MAH CET score is valid for admission for one year only. Those who have appeared for MAH CET 2024, can seek admission to participating colleges this year only (2024-25 batch) Candidates who will appear in MAH MBA CET 2025, their scores will be valid for admission to 2025-2026 batch of MBA programmes only. Those who wish to take a break of one year will have to appear for the exam again. It is good to take a break and appear for the MAH CET exam next year again instead of taking admission in a college that is not of your choice. If you’ve scored below expectation in the current attempt, skip the year, prepare for the exam again, score better the next year and pursue MBA from a college that meets all your parameters.

faqs.question: Can non-technical students pursue an MBA in Data Analytics?
faqs.answer: Yes, even the students from non-technical backgrounds like Commerce , Humanities , and Business Studies can pursue an MBA in Data Analytics . However, they should be willing to learn programming (Python, SQL), statistics and data visualization tools during the course. Many Colleges offer foundation courses to help non-tech students understand the basics of data analytics.

faqs.question: Can I transition into Data Analytics with an MBA in Marketing or Finance?
faqs.answer: Yes, You can absolutely transition into Data Analytics if you already have an MBA in Marketing , Finance, HR , or Operations . Data analytics is used across all business functions, so an MBA in any field can still lead to analytics roles with the right upskilling. To transit into Data Analytics you need to do the following: List: Taking Online Courses – You have to learn Python, SQL, Power BI, and Tableau.; Getting Certifications – You can also transit into Data Analytics by earning a Google Data Analytics or CAP certification.; Gaining Hands-on Experience – You need to Work on real-world data projects.; Applying for Analyst Roles – You can also look for Marketing Analyst, Financial Analyst, or HR Analyst jobs.

faqs.question: Are there any international job opportunities for MBA in Data Analytics graduates?
faqs.answer: Yes, Many global companies hire data-driven business professionals, especially in: To work abroad, you might need certifications like AWS Data Analytics, Google Data Engineer, or CAP. Learning global data privacy laws (GDPR, HIPAA) is also useful. List: USA & Canada – High demand for data analysts, BI consultants, and AI specialists.; UK & Europe – Big opportunities in fintech, healthcare, and retail analytics.; Australia – Growing job market in banking and government analytics.; Middle East (UAE, Qatar, Saudi Arabia) – High salaries in oil, finance, and supply chain analytics.

faqs.question: Do I need to know coding or maths to do this course? I’m not from a tech background.
faqs.answer: Honestly, You don't need to be a coding genius but yes you should be open to learning some basic programming and statistics. Here's the truth: But remember, Before joining, you can do a short online course on Python or Excel. It'll give you a head start and boost your confidence. List: You'll be taught Python or R but only the parts needed for analysis.; You'll learn basic statistics, probability and linear algebra—not PhD-level maths.; If you're from commerce, arts, or management, don't worry! These concepts are taught from scratch in most good colleges.

faqs.question: Can I do MBA in Data Analytics in distance or online mode? Is it worth it?
faqs.answer: Yes, you totally can! There are many reputed institutions offering online or distance MBA in Data Analytics , especially for working professionals. Colleges like NMIMS Global, Amity Online, Jain University, UPES Online, Symbiosis SCDL provide recorded, live classes, access to tools and projects. Some even offer placement support and career guidance. This course is perfect for Working professionals, People who can self-learn and are disciplined But if you are a fresher looking for campus placement or internships then a full-time programme is better option for you.

sections.heading: MBA in Data Analytics Admission 2025: General Eligibility Criteria for MBA

content.text: Here are the details about the eligibility to take admission in MBA in Data Analytics :

rows: MBA in Data Analytics Academic Qualifications

Candidates should possess a bachelor’s degree from a recognized institution. Typically, a background in Physics, Chemistry, Maths, Economics, or statistics is preferred, but many colleges accept candidates from diverse academic disciplines. Work experience is not mandatory, but is highly preferred in some colleges.
MBA in Data Analytics Marks Criteria

Applicants should have a minimum aggregate of 50% marks for the unreserved category, and 40-45% marks for the reserved category. Candidates should have a valid score in the entrance exam and have cleared the interview.
MBA in Data Analytics Age Limit
There is no maximum age limit for pursuing an MBA in Data Analytics course.

content.text: Admission procedure may vary. Check the table below:

rows: MAT PBT - 31 May ' 25 MAT CBT - 08 Jun ' 25

content.text: Given below is a description of syllabus:

rows: The CAT exam syllabus includes three subjects – Verbal Ability & Reading Comprehension (VARC), Data Interpretation & Logical Reasoning (DILR), and Quantitative Aptitude (QA). The main topics of focus while covering the CAT syllabus are Arithmetic, Algebra, Geometry, Percentages, Graphs, English Grammar, Coding-Decoding, Series Completion, etc.

MAT Syllabus includes Language Comprehension, Data Analysis and Sufficiency, Mathematical Skills, and Indian and Global Environment. The syllabus for MAT has been designed to check the candidate’s analytical skills, logical aptitude, English comprehension, and general awareness.
The XAT exam syllabus includes topics from decision-making, Verbal & Logical Ability, Quantitative Ability & Data Interpretation, and General Knowledge.
CMAT Syllabus consists of five subjects – Quantitative Techniques & Data Interpretation, Logical Reasoning, Language Comprehension, General Awareness, and Innovation & Entrepreneurship.
SNAP syllabus includes topics from General English, Quantitative Ability, and Reasoning like other entrance exam syllabi.

questions.question_text: hi we are providing online education in data Science and data analytics we want to register on your portal
What is the admission deadline for MSc in Data Analytics programme at Dublin City University?

answers.answer_text: As per the official schedule for Dublin City University admissions , for the MSc in Data Analytics the students can apply in the September intake of the year. The admission deadlines for the same are generally in Jun or July during the same year . For this program, there is no other of intake at DCU. International students can apply via the official portal of this university.

questions.question_text: I am looking for a Post Graduate DEGREE course in DATA Science / DATA ANALYTICS related field in INDIA?

answers.answer_text: aaft noida should be your first choice there are really good environment and the infrastucture for ai

questions.question_text: Which colleges offer Data Science courses? What are the job opportunities in data science?

answers.answer_text: Many Universities & colleges are offering Data Science courses one of best institute is AAFT Noida which offers Data Science BSc, MSc & Diploma courses.  Lot of Job options are available like Data Analyst, Data Scientist etc.

questions.question_text: In which institutes Data Science & artificial intelligence degree course is available?

answers.answer_text: 1.Many institutes offer Data Science and AI degree courses today. 2. Top options include IITs, IIITs, and leading universities across India. 3. Private universities like Amity, VIT, and SRM also provide these programs. 4. Some global universities such as MIT and Oxford offer strong AI degrees. 5. Training institutes like Datamites help students build skills for these courses.

questions.question_text: Can I learn a data analyst course in 1 month with a certificate? I am pursuing BCom and have a good communication skill.

answers.answer_text: Yes, you can learn a basic data analyst course in 1 month and get a certificate. Datamites has simple beginner courses that you can finish in a short time. Your BCom background and good communication skills will help you understand the topics quickly. You may not become an expert in one month, but you can build a strong starting point. Keep learning and practicing to improve your skills further.

questions.question_text: Which course is best for a data analyst?

answers.answer_text: The best course for a data analyst is one that teaches SQL, Excel, Python, and data visualization in a simple way. Datamites offers beginner-friendly programs that cover all these skills with real projects and easy learning steps. They also provide good job guidance, making Datamites a strong choice for anyone starting a data analyst career.

questions.question_text: How long is the MSc Data Analytics course of QUB?

answers.answer_text: The duration of Queen's University Belfast MSc Data Analytics course is one-year. Special highlights of this course include the Analytics in Action module and commitment of industry to offer real data for projects. Admission to this course can be done if the students have a 2:1 Honors degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Applications or equivalent. An IELTS score of 6.5 is required.

questions.question_text: Are there any data/business analytics or data Science courses in du?

answers.answer_text: Yes, there are several data/analytics course in DU. Here are some of the best courses in DU. Data Analytics and Business Intelligence, offered by Shaheed sukhdev college of Business studies. Business Analytics (BMS) at Shaheed sukhdev college of business. Data Science, ML and Business Analytics offered by Hansraj College. Data Science/Big Data Analytics Specialization (DU SOL Online MCA) I hope this will help you.
